DataElement.preferredDefinition: The name that describes the type biological or pharmacological potency of a drug procedure.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Techniques used in laboratory for research purposes. NCI Metathesaurus code: CL026563

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Laboratory; a workplace for the conduct of scientific research.

Concepts.definition: A facility equipped and competent to conduct scientific experiments, observations, tests, investigations, and/or to manufacture chemicals or medical products.

ObjectClass.changeDescription: updated to add concept code. dw

Property.preferredDefinition: Scientific or clinical procedures and methods.

Concepts.definition: A practiced and regimented skill or series of actions.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A Conceptual Domain to capture value meanings specfic to SPOREs not suitable for placement elsewhere.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Changed name to match Context per Hvroje Med.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The name that describes the type biological or pharmacological potency of a drug procedure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The ability of lymphoid cells to mount a humoral or cellular immune response when challenged by antigen.

Concepts.definition: The ability of lymphoid cells to mount a humoral or cellular immune response when challenged by antigen.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Antigen aggregation with antibody, in the right ratios, to cause precipitation.

Concepts.definition: Antigen aggregation with antibody, in the right ratios, to cause precipitation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Identification of proteins or peptides that have been separated by gel electrophoresis and transferred (blotted) to strips of nitrocellulose paper. The blots are then detected by enzymatically labelled or radiolabeled antibody probes.

Concepts.definition: A laboratory procedure for the detection or identification of proteins or peptides that have been separated by gel electrophoresis and transferred onto nitrocellulose or other type of paper or nylon membrane. The proteins are then detected by reaction with enzymatically labeled or radiolabeled antibody probes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic test in which an antibody is used to link a cellular antigen specifically to a stain that can be seen with a microscope.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic test in which an antibody is used to link a cellular antigen specifically to a stain that can be seen with a microscope.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A highly sensitive technique for detecting and measuring antigens or antibodies in a solution; the solution is run over a surface to which immobilized antibodies specific to the substance have been attatched, and if the substance is present, it will bind to the antibody layer, and its presence is verified and visualized with an application of antibodies that have been tagged in some way. (BioTech Life Science Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: A highly sensitive technique for detecting and measuring antigens or antibodies in a solution; the solution is run over a surface to which immobilized antibodies specific to the substance have been attached, and if the substance is present, it will bind to the antibody layer, and its presence is verified and visualized with an application of antibodies that have been tagged in some way. (BioTech Life Science Dictionary)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Tests, examinations, evaluations used to determine a subject's status or response to intervention.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Created initially to support CCR value domain for CTMS.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The determination of the amount of a particular constituent of a mixture or of the biological or pharmacological potency of a drug.:A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: A qualitative or quantitative analysis performed to determine the amount of a particular constituent in a sample or the biological or pharmacological properties of a drug.
A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: DCTD (Division of Cancer Treatment and Diagnosis)
